intro: Borreria valerianoides f. minor, commonly known as the lesser borreria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its foliage is usually dense and has a slightly aromatic scent, contributing to its appeal in horticultural settings.
